item.title: [Itrfoundation] FDR’s Forgotten Blueprint for Property Tax Reform
item.description:
FDR’s 1932 Sioux City speech championed fiscal conservatism, calling for smaller, more efficient government and criticizing excessive federal and local spending.

Roosevelt emphasized the burden of local government, noting that half of taxpayer dollars went to cities, counties, and townships, and urged local officials to cut waste and deliver better value to taxpayers.

Though his later policies contradicted this message, Roosevelt’s campaign remarks offer a surprising blueprint for Iowa policymakers today as they pursue property tax reform and spending restraint.

The post FDR’s Forgotten Blueprint for Property Tax Reform appeared first on ITR Foundation.
